metadata.feature_description: Configure and manage content approval workflows with multiple states and permissions

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Workflow in Persona Bar
steps.expected: Workflows management page should load with list of existing workflows
steps.actual: Workflows page loaded showing existing workflows: Direct Publish, Save Draft, Content Approval, Test Workflow, and Test & <> 'Special' Chars!

steps.expected: New workflow form should appear with empty name and description fields
steps.actual: New workflow form appeared with 'NewWorkflow' as default name and empty description

steps.action: Enter workflow name 'Test Approval Workflow' and description
steps.expected: Text should be entered in the fields
steps.actual: Successfully entered 'Test Approval Workflow' as name and 'A test workflow for multi-stage content approval process' as description

steps.expected: Workflow should be saved and appear in the list
steps.actual: Workflow was saved successfully. The workflow appeared in the list with the description displayed

steps.action: Click 'Add a State' button on Test Workflow
steps.actual: Dialog appeared with 'Workflow State New' title, showing state name field, reviewers configuration with role checkboxes, and notification options

steps.action: Enter 'Secondary Review' as state name and click Accept
steps.expected: State should be added to the workflow
steps.actual: State 'Secondary Review' was added at position 3, with Published moved to position 4. The state table now shows: Draft (1), Approval Review (2), Secondary Review (3), Published (4)

steps.action: Click Edit (E) icon on Secondary Review state
steps.expected: Edit state dialog should appear with current state properties
steps.actual: Dialog appeared with 'Workflow State Edit' title, showing 'You are editing the Secondary Review workflow state' message, state name field with 'Secondary Review', reviewers configuration, and notification options

steps.action: Change state name to 'Manager Review' and click Accept
steps.actual: State was successfully renamed from 'Secondary Review' to 'Manager Review' at position 3

steps.action: Click Delete (D) icon on Manager Review state
steps.actual: Confirmation dialog appeared with warning icon asking 'Are you sure you want to delete the Manager Review State?' with No and Yes buttons

steps.expected: State should be removed from the workflow
steps.actual: State was deleted. The workflow now shows only 3 states: Draft (1), Approval Review (2), Published (3)

steps.action: Clear the workflow name field to leave it empty
steps.expected: Validation error should appear and Save button should be disabled
steps.actual: Red validation error message 'This field is required.' appeared above the empty field, and the Save button became disabled (grayed out)

steps.action: Observe state permissions in Add/Edit state dialog
steps.expected: Should be able to configure reviewers for workflow states
steps.actual: The Add/Edit state dialogs show Reviewers section with: Filter By Group dropdown, Select Role dropdown, Add button, role permission table with Review checkboxes (Administrators locked, Content Managers configurable), and Add User section for adding specific users. Notification options for Author and Admin are also configurable.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View workflow list with default and in-use status

steps.expected: Should show workflows with IN USE and DEFAULT status indicators
steps.actual: Workflows page displays all workflows with columns: WORKFLOW TYPE, IN USE (checkmarks), ACTIONS (edit/delete icons), DEFAULT (radio buttons). 'Save Draft' is marked as default. Direct Publish, Save Draft, and Content Approval show checkmarks indicating they are in use.

observations: The workflow management is handled at the site level through Settings > Workflow in the Persona Bar, not at the module level as suggested by the feature's UI Location 'Module Settings > Workflow Settings'
The HTMLPro module uses these site-level workflows through the Evoq Content Workflow engine, but the workflow configuration itself is done at the site administration level
Workflows that are 'in use' have their 'Add a State' button disabled, preventing modification while content is using that workflow
First and last states (Draft/Published) cannot be deleted from workflows - only intermediate states can be deleted
Code files in WorkflowStateController.cs show the HTMLPro module has its own workflow state management that integrates with the Evoq Content Workflow system via WorkflowMigrationController
The system supports role-based and user-based permissions for workflow state reviewers
